str2: A learner, disciple, pupil. From manthano; a learner, i.e. Pupil.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To go out, come out. From ek and erchomai; to issue.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural

str2: A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A city, the inhabitants of a city. Probably from the same as polemos, or perhaps from polus; a town.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: A prolonged form of a primary heuro, which heureo is used for it in all the tenses except the present and imperfect to find.
According to the manner in which, in the degree that, just as, as. From kata and hos; just as, that.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To make ready, prepare. From hetoimos; to prepare.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
The feast of Passover, the Passover lamb. Of Chaldee origin; the Passover.
